json.text:
This is Mark from our MarkTeacher.com with
another high band IELTS speaking answer.

This IELTS example answer is about
friends. Is it important to have friends

from other countries? I'd say definitely
yes. Simply because it gives you so many

opportunities to learn. Having an
outsider's perspective on your own

country can make you more tolerant of
different points of view. It can help you

understand that there are different sets
of values all over the world and every

country is unique. You'd also get the
chance to learn something about their

culture as well, you could learn about
their customs, their language, and their

attitudes and their values. All of these
things together can make you more

open-minded and more tolerant of
different nations and I think that's

really important to realize, especially
at a young age - that you're not the only

country on the planet and the way your
culture does things isn't always the

best way either. So I think that's a good
way to fight intolerance and help people

become more accepting of other countries.
check out MarkTeacher.com for more IELTS

courses, lessons, and tips check out Maher
teacher comm for more helps courses
